isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine Service, Model Year 1994 - 1998 - CRANKCASE, CRANKSHAFT, CONNECTING RODS AND PISTONS - Crankshaft and Main Bearings - Installation of Crankshaft

note.para: Make sure the crankcase has been inspected before installation.

step1.para: Use a lint-free cloth to wipe any oil off the crankcase bearing supports.
Clean the bearing inserts and bearing caps thoroughly in solvent. Dry them with filtered compressed air.
Inspect each bearing. Replace any bearings that are scored, chipped or worn.

figure.caption: Lubricating the Upper Main Bearing Inserts

step1.para: Lubricate the upper main bearing inserts with clean engine oil and insert them into the crankcase main bearing supports.

note.para: Make sure the locking tabs on the bearings are aligned with the slots in the crankcase saddle. Also, the oil holes in the bearing shells must line up with the oil holes in crankcase.

warning.para: To avoid engine damage, serious personal injury or possibly death, use an appropriate lifting sling when installing the crankshaft into the crankcase.

figure.caption: Installing the Crankshaft Into the Crankcase

step1.para: Attach an appropriate lifting sling to the crankshaft and carefully lower it onto the main bearing saddle in the crankcase.
